pageTitle: Itinerary for Monday, August 15, 2016 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Monday, August 15, 2016:

Corner Brook, Newfoundland and Labrador

7:45 a.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the Premier of Newfoundland and Labrador, Dwight Ball.

Strawberry Hill Resort
1 Strawberry Lane
Corner Brook, Newfoundland and Labrador

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity only
  • Media should arrive no later than 7:20 a.m.

8:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will attend a community breakfast with Member of Parliament Gudie Hutchings and will hold an informal media availability.

Grenfell Campus, Memorial University
20 University Drive
Corner Brook, Newfoundland and Labrador

Notes for media:

  • Open media coverage
  • Media should arrive no later than 8:00 a.m.
  • Media should report to The Danger Tree monument at Grenfell Campus, Memorial University, upon arrival

Conception Bay South, Newfoundland and Labrador

12:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will visit the Newfoundland and Labrador Summer Games Meal Hall with Member of Parliament Ken McDonald.

St. Thomas of Villanova Parish Hall
2694 Topsail Road (address of the school next door)
Conception Bay South, Newfoundland and Labrador

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity only
  • Media should arrive no later than 11:45 a.m.

12:50 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a Newfoundland and Labrador Summer Games soccer game with Member of Parliament Ken McDonald.

Conception Bay South Arena
2500 Topsail Road
Conception Bay South, Newfoundland and Labrador

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity only
  • Media should arrive no later than 12:20 p.m.

Caraquet, New Brunswick

5:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will deliver brief remarks and attend the 37th Grand Tintamarre with the Premier of New Brunswick, Brian Gallant, Minister of Canadian Heritage, Melanie Joly, Leader of the Government in the House of Commons and Minister of Fisheries, Oceans and the Canadian Coast Guard, Dominic LeBlanc, and Member of Parliament Serge Cormier.

Place du festival
220 Boulevard Saint-Pierre
Caraquet, New Brunswick

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media should arrive no later than 4:45 p.m.

Media appearance

7:00 p.m. A brief interview with the Prime Minister will be broadcast live on Radio-Canada Téléjournal Acadie.

Please note: all times are local.

PMO Media Relations:
media@pmo-cpm.gc.ca
613-957-5555
